title: Wrangler Git Hooks Configuration
description: Configuration schema for wrangler git hooks enforcement framework

$schema.description: JSON Schema reference for IDE support

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when configuration was created

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when configuration was last updated

testCommand.description: Command to run full test suite (used in pre-push)

unitTestCommand.description: Command to run unit tests only (used in pre-commit, faster than full suite)

formatCommand.description: Command to format code (used in pre-commit, auto-fixes and re-stages)

lintCommand.description: Command to lint code (used in pre-commit)

protectedBranches.description: Branch patterns that require full test suite before push

skipDocsOnlyChanges.description: Skip tests when only documentation files are changed

docsPatterns.description: File patterns considered as documentation (for docs-only detection)

enableCommitMsgValidation.description: Enable commit message format validation (Conventional Commits)

commitMsgPattern.description: Regex pattern for valid commit message format

commitMsgMinLength.description: Minimum length for commit message subject line

commitMsgMaxLength.description: Maximum length for commit message subject line

bypassEnvVar.description: Environment variable name to bypass hooks (value must be '1' or 'true')

projectType.description: Project language/framework type (used for smart defaults)

pattern.description: Installation pattern: A = hooks in .git/hooks, B = version-controlled in .wrangler/git-hooks
